intro: Clidemia ombrophila, commonly known as the misty leaf or velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Clidemia ombrophila is also known for its ability to form dense mats, which can contribute to soil stabilization and moisture retention.
